...by a responsible government.
 
 http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/9079598/
 
 Here's a story about two recent fires in Paris...one killed 14 because of overcrowding and apparent lack of a sprinkler system, the other killed 24, apparently caused by a scorned woman who left the building in a huff after lighting a candle for a romantic interlude, then finding her boyfriend, who happened to be the night watchman...DRUNK!
 
 Stories about deadly fires tend to tick me off since part of my job is to design fire safety into facilities. France should be ashamed for letting these things happen. Maybe they should adopt and enforce our NFPA Codes.

post_info.post_title: Deadly fires in Paris could be prevented...

who happened to be the night watchman...DRUNK!

 There is absolutely no way you can blame the government because the night watchman was drunk.
 
 It's like blaming an accident caused by a drunk train driver on the government.
 
 Over-crowding and lack of fire security are a whole different matter of course.
 
 -Wez
